00018 BdkBinning::BdkBinning(int nDivMid,
00019                        TTree * dataSR,
00020                        TTree * dataSB) :
00021   _wgtListsMade(kFALSE),
00022   _wfCalculated(kFALSE),

00033 void BdkBinning::setNDivMid(int nDivMid) {
00034   _nDivMid = nDivMid;
00035 
00036   // Remove any old bins:
00037   _bins.clear();
00038 
00039   // Make the bins. We need at least 2*_nDivMid bins, so make 3*:
00040   const int nDiv = 3 * _nDivMid;
00041   const double space = BdkDP::symValue() / _nDivMid;
00042   int lastNBins = 0;
00043 
00044   cout << "BdkBinning::setNDivMid(" << nDivMid << "): Creating bins" << endl;
00045   for (int ix = 0; ix <= nDiv; ++ix) {
00046     for (int iy = 0; iy <= nDiv; ++iy) {
00047       // At each grid point put the corner of a straight bin and a mirror bin:
00048       BdkP2 point(ix * space, iy * space);
00049       BdkTriBin bin    (point, space, kFALSE);
00050       BdkTriBin binMirr(point, space, kTRUE );
00051       addBin(bin);
00052       addBin(binMirr);
00053     } // end loop on column
00054     cout << "Added " << _bins.size() - lastNBins 
00055          << " bins to vertical column " << ix << endl;
00056     
00057     lastNBins = _bins.size();
00058   } // end loop on row
00059  
00060   _wgtListsMade = kFALSE;
00061   _wfCalculated = kFALSE;
00062 }

00066   _dataSR = dataSR;
00067   _dataSB = dataSB;
00068   _wfCalculated = kFALSE;
00069 }

00072 // Divide a bin into three. Returns true if found the bin, false otherwise:
00073 Bool_t BdkBinning::divideBin(int index) {
00074   // First, make all the symmetry-related bins:
00075   BdkTriBin & bin = _bins.at(index);
00076   vector<BdkTriBin> symBins;
00077   symBins.push_back(bin);
00078   symBins.push_back(bin.R());
00079   symBins.push_back(bin.RR());
00080   symBins.push_back(bin.E());
00081   symBins.push_back(bin.ER());
00082   symBins.push_back(bin.ERR());
00083 
00084   for (int b = 0; b < symBins.size(); ++b) {
00085     // Find the corresponding bin in _bins:
00086     int oldBinIndex = binIndex(symBins[b]);
00087     BdkTriBin & oldBin = _bins.at(oldBinIndex);
00088 
00089     // Divide it:
00090     vector<BdkTriBin> newBins = oldBin.divide();
00091 
00092     // Remove oldBin and add its new sub-bins:
00093     vector<BdkTriBin>::iterator iter = _bins.begin();
00094     for (int dummy = 0; dummy < oldBinIndex; ++dummy) {
00095       ++iter;
00096     }
00097     _bins.erase(iter);
00098 
00099     for (int nb = 0; nb < newBins.size(); ++nb){
00100       addBin(newBins[nb]);
00101     }
00102   } // end loop on the symmetry-related bins of _bins[index]
00103     
00104   _wgtListsMade = kFALSE;
00105   _wfCalculated = kFALSE;
00106   
00107   return kTRUE;  // success
00108 }
00109 
00110 
00111 Bool_t BdkBinning::divideBin(const BdkP2 & point) {
00112   int index = binIndexContaining(point);
00113   if (0 > index) {
00114     return kTRUE;
00115   }
00116   return divideBin(index);
00117 }

00120 // Builds the symmetry relations between the bins:
00121 void BdkBinning::buildWgtLists() {
00122   if (kTRUE == _wgtListsMade) {
00123     return;
00124   }
00125 
00126   cout << "BdkBinning::buildWgtLists(): making weight lists for " 
00127        <<  _bins.size() << " bins:" << endl;
00128 
00129   // Get each bin's symmetry-related bins:
00130   for(int b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00131     if (b%10 == 0) { // monitor progress
00132       cout << "Bin " << b << endl;
00133     }
00134 
00135     // The bin whose symmetry related bins we're looking for
00136     BdkTriBin & theBin = _bins[b];
00137 
00138     // Its symmetry-related bins (temp objects):
00139       const BdkTriBin & binR = _bins[binIndex(theBin.R())];
00140       const BdkTriBin & binRR = _bins[binIndex(theBin.RR())];
00141       const BdkTriBin & binE = _bins[binIndex(theBin.E())];
00142       const BdkTriBin & binER = _bins[binIndex(theBin.ER())];
00143       const BdkTriBin & binERR = _bins[binIndex(theBin.ERR())];
00144 
00145     // For each of the operator-related binWgtList objects of this bin,
00146     // set all the symmetry-related bins:
00147     for (int op = 0; op < BdkIsoOp::NOPS; ++op) {
00148       BdkBinWgtList & wgtList = theBin._wgtList[op];
00149       
00150       // Find the bins in _bins that are equivalent to theBin's
00151       // symmetry-related bins:
00152       wgtList.setI(theBin);      
00153       wgtList.setR(binR);      
00154       wgtList.setRR(binRR);      
00155       wgtList.setE(binE);      
00156       wgtList.setER(binER);      
00157       wgtList.setERR(binERR);
00158     }
00159   }
00160   cout << endl;
00161   _wgtListsMade = kTRUE;
00162 }

00165 void BdkBinning::setDataToBins(TTree * tree) {
00166   cout << "BdkBinning::setDataToBins(...): Filling bins from tree \"" 
00167        << tree->GetName() << "\"." << endl;
00168 
00169   if (tree != _dataSB && tree != _dataSR) {
00170     cout << "*** BdkBinning::setDataToBins(): given unfamiliar tree."
00171          << endl;
00172     assert(0);
00173   }
00174   
00175   double s12, s13;
00176   TBranch * bS12 = tree->GetBranch("s12");
00177   TBranch * bS13 = tree->GetBranch("s13");
00178   bS12->SetAddress(&s12); 
00179   bS13->SetAddress(&s13); 
00180   
00181   int nRejectedPoints = 0;
00182   // loop over events:
00183   for (int e = 0; e < tree->GetEntries(); ++e) {
00184     bS12->GetEntry(e);
00185     bS13->GetEntry(e);
00186     BdkP2 point(s12, s13);
00187     
00188     if (kFALSE == point.inDalitz()) {
00189       ++nRejectedPoints;
00190       continue;  // don't take points outside the DP
00191     }
00192     
00193     // Loop over bins and find the one that contains the event:
00194     for (int b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00195       if (_bins[b].contains(point)) {
00196         if (tree == _dataSR) {
00197           _bins[b].accumNEventsSR();
00198         }
00199         else {
00200           _bins[b].accumNEventsSB();
00201         }
00202         break; // out of the loop on bins and on to the next event
00203       } // end if this is the bin containing the point
00204     } // end loop on bins
00205   } // end loop on events
00206 
00207   cout << tree->GetEntries() - nRejectedPoints
00208        << " points added to bins. " << nRejectedPoints
00209        << " points outside the DP were rejected." << endl;
00210 }

00214 void BdkBinning::calcWFs(double mDratioSRtoSB) {
00215   if (kTRUE == _wfCalculated) {
00216     return;
00217   }
00218 
00219   // Read the data sets:
00220   setDataToBins(_dataSR);
00221   setDataToBins(_dataSB);
00222 
00223   // then calculate the wf's:
00224   for (int b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00225     _bins[b].calcWaveFunc(mDratioSRtoSB);
00226   }
00227 
00228   _wfCalculated = kTRUE;
00229 }

00231 
00232 // Calculate operator expectation values and errors:
00233 void BdkBinning::calcEVs() {
00234   // set up the necessary information:
00235   calcWFs(); 
00236   buildWgtLists();
00237 
00238   // calculate expectation values:
00239   int b;  // bin index
00240 
00241   // Calculate the sum over the squares of the wave functions, which
00242   // is the denominator in the EV expression:
00243   double sumWFSQ = 0;
00244   for (b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00245     double wf = _bins[b].waveFunc();
00246     sumWFSQ += wf * wf;
00247   }
00248 
00249   // Loop over operators and calcuate the EV's:
00250   for (int isoOp = 0; isoOp < BdkIsoOp::NOPS; ++isoOp) {
00251     // Zero-out the EV:
00252     _ev[isoOp] = 0;
00253     
00254     // Calculate the numerator:
00255     for (b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00256       double wf = _bins[b].waveFunc();
00257   
00258       // This wave function has to be multiplied by the sum of the
00259       // wave functions and weights of all the bins with a symmetry
00260       // relation to this bin:
00261       double sumWgtsWFs = 0;
00262       const BdkBinWgtList & wgtList = _bins[b].wgtList(isoOp);
00263       for (int symOp = 0; symOp < BdkSymOp::NOPS; ++symOp) {
00264         const BdkBinWgt & binWgt = wgtList.binWgt(symOp);
00265         double binWeight = binWgt.weight();
00266         double binWf = binWgt.bin()->waveFunc();
00267         sumWgtsWFs += binWeight * binWf;
00268       }
00269      
00270       // Do the said multiplication:
00271       _ev[isoOp] += wf * sumWgtsWFs;
00272     }
00273 
00274     // Divide by the denominator:
00275     _ev[isoOp] /= sumWFSQ;
00276   } // End loop on isoOp, calculation of expectation values
00277 
00278   // Now calculate the error matrix:
00279   int i;
00280   for (i = 0; i < BdkIsoOp::NOPS; ++i) { // loop on matrix rows
00281     for (int j = i; j < BdkIsoOp::NOPS; ++j) {  // on matrix columns
00282       _evErr[j][j] = 0.0; // initialize
00283       for (int a = 0; a < _bins.size(); ++a) {  // on bins
00284         const BdkTriBin & bin = _bins[a];
00285         const double wf = bin.waveFunc();
00286         const double wfErr = bin.waveFuncErr();
00287 
00288         // Get the two wgtLists and calculate the first terms (sums)
00289         // inside the square brackets of Eq (45) in isospin-detail-13:
00290         const BdkBinWgtList * wgtList[2] = {&(bin.wgtList(i)), 
00291                                             &(bin.wgtList(j))};
00292                                             
00293         double term[2] = {0,0};
00294         // Loop over the two lists to calculate the two terms:
00295         for (int f = 0; f < 2; ++f) {
00296           // For each list, loop over the symmetry-related bins and
00297           // get the weights:
00298           for (int symOp = 0; symOp < BdkSymOp::NOPS; ++symOp) {
00299             // Get the binWgt of bin with its symmetry-related bin:
00300             const BdkBinWgt & binWgt = wgtList[f]->binWgt(symOp);
00301 
00302             // From this, get the weight:
00303             const double binWeight = binWgt.weight();
00304 
00305             // and also get the symmetry related bin:
00306             const BdkTriBin * symBin = binWgt.bin();
00307 
00308             // Get the symmetry-related bin's wave function:
00309             const double binWf = symBin->waveFunc();
00310 
00311             // Get the reverse weight, i.e., the symmetry-related
00312             // bin's weight for to transform into bin:
00313             const BdkBinWgtList & reverseWgtList = 
00314               symBin->wgtList(wgtList[f]->op());
00315 
00316             const BdkBinWgt * reverseBinWgt = reverseWgtList.binWgt(bin);
00317             assert(reverseBinWgt != 0);
00318             const double reverseWgt = reverseBinWgt->weight();
00319 
00320             // Now make the necessary calculation:
00321             term[f] += binWf * (binWeight + reverseWgt);
00322           } // end loop on symOp to calculate terms
00323          
00324         } // end loop on f (the two square brackets in Eq (45)) 
00325         
00326         // Now subtract from term[f] the second term in Eq (45):
00327         term[0] -= 2 * wf * _ev[i];
00328         term[1] -= 2 * wf * _ev[j];
00329 
00330         // Complete the product of Eq (45) and accumulate the term
00331         // into element of matrix:
00332         _evErr[i][j] += term[0] * wfErr * wfErr * term[1] / sumWFSQ;
00333       } // end loop on bins (index a)
00334     } // end loop on matrix columns
00335   } // end loop on matrix rows
00336 
00337   // Now symmetrize the matrix:
00338   for (i = 0; i < BdkIsoOp::NOPS; ++i) { // loop on matrix rows
00339     for (int j = 0; j < i; ++j) {  // on matrix columns
00340       _evErr[i][j] = _evErr[j][i];
00341     }
00342   }
00343 }

00346 
00347 const BdkTriBin & BdkBinning::bin(const BdkP2 & point) const {
00348   return _bins.at(binIndexContaining(point));
00349 }
00350 
00351 int BdkBinning::binIndexContaining(const BdkP2 & point) const {
00352   for (int b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00353     if (_bins[b].contains(point)) {
00354       return b;
00355     }
00356   }
00357   return -1;  // not found
00358 }

00360 
00361 int BdkBinning::binIndex(const BdkTriBin & bin) const {
00362   for (int b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00363     if (_bins[b] == bin) {  // operator== compares both center() and area() 
00364       return b;
00365     }
00366   }
00367   return -1;  // not found
00368 }

00370 
00371  double BdkBinning::ev(int isoOp) const {
00372    assert(isoOp > -1 && isoOp < BdkIsoOp::NOPS);
00373    return _ev[isoOp];
00374  }

00377 
00378 TCanvas * BdkBinning::Draw(Bool_t writeName,
00379                            Bool_t drawSymLines,
00380                            const char * drawDataOption) const {
00381 
00382   TCanvas * can = new TCanvas("Binning", "Binning", 800, 800);
00383 
00384   TH2F * h = new TH2F("Binning", "Binning", 30, 0, 
00385                       BdkDP::edge(), 30, 0, BdkDP::edge());
00386   
00387   h->SetXTitle("s_{12}");
00388   h->SetYTitle("s_{13}");
00389   h->Draw();
00390 
00391   if (TString(drawDataOption) == "SR" && 0 != _dataSR) {
00392     _dataSR->Draw("s13:s12", 0, "same");
00393   }
00394   else if (TString(drawDataOption) == "SB" && 0 != _dataSB) {
00395     _dataSB->Draw("s13:s12", 0, "same");
00396   }
00397 
00398 
00399   // Draw the Dalitz plot boundary:
00400   BdkDP::drawBoundary();
00401   
00402   if (drawSymLines) {
00403     // Draw the symmetry axes:
00404     BdkDP::drawE12Line();
00405     BdkDP::drawE13Line();
00406     BdkDP::drawE23Line();
00407   }
00408 
00409   // Draw all the bins:
00410   for (int b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00411     _bins[b].Draw(kBlack, 1, kFALSE, writeName);
00412   }
00413 
00414   return can;
00415 }

00418 // Tag a bin and its symmetry-related bins:
00419 void BdkBinning::tagBin(int index, const char * nameChar) {
00420   TString name(nameChar);
00421 
00422   BdkTriBin & theBin = _bins.at(index);
00423   theBin.setName(name);
00424   
00425   BdkTriBin & binR = _bins[binIndex(theBin.R())];
00426   binR.setName(TString("R*") + name);
00427   
00428   BdkTriBin & binRR = _bins[binIndex(theBin.RR())];
00429   binRR.setName(TString("RR*") + name);
00430   
00431   BdkTriBin & binE = _bins[binIndex(theBin.E())];
00432   binE.setName(TString("E*") + name);
00433   
00434   BdkTriBin & binER = _bins[binIndex(theBin.ER())];
00435   binER.setName(TString("ER*") + name);
00436   
00437   BdkTriBin & binERR = _bins[binIndex(theBin.ERR())];
00438   binERR.setName(TString("ERR*") + name);
00439 }

00475 // Set all bin names to their inDalitzFrac():
00476 void BdkBinning::setBinNamesInDalitzFrac() {
00477   for (int b = 0; b < _bins.size(); ++b) {
00478     BdkTriBin & bin = _bins[b];
00479     TString name;
00480     name += bin.inDalitzFrac();
00481     // clean the string of initial spaces:
00482     const char * nameStr = name;
00483     while(nameStr[0] == ' ') {
00484       ++nameStr;
00485     }
00486     bin.setName(nameStr);
00487   }
00488 }

00536 
00537 void BdkBinning::addBin(BdkTriBin & bin) {
00538   // Add the bin to the vector if it is at least partly inside the DP:
00539   BdkTriBin::InDalitzCode code = bin.inDalitzStat();
00540   if (BdkTriBin::NONE != code) {
00541     _bins.push_back(bin);
00542   }
00543 }
